Steps.Message: Update at 19:08 - Sorry your power has gone off again today. Our engineers investigated the fault earlier but it seems there may be a bigger underlying issue. This is making our network weak and causing substation equipment to fault. Our engineers are on site  and using an average timeframe, we are aiming to have all power back on between 19:30 and 20:30.

We became aware of a power cut at 16:20. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power restored

Logs.Comment: Update at 19:08 - Sorry your power has gone off again today. Our engineers investigated the fault earlier but it seems there may be a bigger underlying issue. This is making our network weak and causing substation equipment to fault. Our engineers are on site  and using an average timeframe, we are aiming to have all power back on between 19:30 and 20:30.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.
